item.title: Website login system - Snippet
item.dc:creator: @Pink_Phat Pink Phat
item.description:
@Pink_Phat wrote:

[quote=“Whackatre, post:37, topic:464408”][quote author=The Web Guy link=topic=568367.msg4129709#msg4129709 date=1350930150]

I have no idea who you are. I’m always deleting people from my skype contacts. Your nothing to me. Stop trying to make any attempt of contact with me. Go post something better if your that concerned over this.

Earlier you said,
“I deleted you because you were a prick. I do not know you.”
Obviously you know who I am if you can remember the reason you deleted me, are you this retarded? Also, please learn the difference between you’re and your, this is my work and even if it’s a crappy script, you should give me credit. You know who I am, and you know that this isn’t yours.

plz learn what a comma splice is if ur gonna correct others’ grammar plz ty.

I’m aware of the definition of a comma slice, don’t be hypocritical, you shouldn’t be pointing out others grammar either, considering the fact you still say, “ur” instead of “your” …

As for HcoJustin, It’s not like I released it as open-source, but rather gave it to her to learn from, she’s posting it as if she wrote it herself.
[/quote]
yea fuck off; also, it’s called a comma splice, not a comma slice.

oh and ps: you did it again![/quote]

en.wikipedia.org

Comma splice

In English grammar, a comma splice or comma fault is the use of a comma to join two independent clauses. For example: It is nearly half past five, we cannot reach town before dark.[a] The comma splice is sometimes used in literary writing to convey a particular mood of informality. Otherwise, it is usually considered a style error in English. Most authorities on English usage consider comma splices appropriate in limited situations, such as in informal writing or with short similar phrases.

Read full topic

item.title: Website login system - Snippet
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:30, topic:464408”][quote author=The Web Guy link=topic=568367.msg4129709#msg4129709 date=1350930150]
As for HcoJustin, It’s not like I released it as open-source, but rather gave it to her to learn from, she’s posting it as if she wrote it herself.
[/quote]
As soon as you sent it away you lost all hope of keeping it private. Why hate on her for acting like its hers, you guys do it with servers 24/7?

Just because it’s the internet doesn’t mean you can be a theif/prick. It isn’t yours to actually release (and in this case, it is easy for people to assume it si the OP’s).

Tell that to the hundreds of server owners out there.

There is photo evidence, and I had a conversation with Aj about this, long before the arguing started about how he helped her.

There is photo evidence Microsoft made Windows yet it is still all over the internet. It happens daily, get used to it. No one cares about shitty code, He should have kept his mouth shut anyways, I’d be embarrassed to take ownership of that[/quote]

I gave it away for her to learn from, not directly take it and claim it’s hers. As you can see, she’s a bitch anyways.

Read full topic

item.title: Website login system - Snippet
item.dc:creator: @justaguy justaguy
item.description:
@justaguy wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:34, topic:464408”]Anything can be released without credit unless it includes a legitimate license (GNU, etc.)

/end[/quote]

I’m pretty sure that isn’t the case, but oh well. If it ain’t my stuff, I don’t care as much.

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:32, topic:464408”][quote author=justaguy link=topic=568367.msg4129798#msg4129798 date=1350937887]

Just because it’s the internet doesn’t mean you can be a theif/prick. It isn’t yours to actually release (and in this case, it is easy for people to assume it si the OP’s).

Tell that to the hundreds of server owners out there.

It is quite obvious most 13-17 year olds don’t even know what plagiarism actually is or how much it can affect you (especially post-secondary when you’re writing essays and reports). Even so, that point shouldn’t make it accepted behaviour.
[/quote]

Ignorance is no excuse.[/quote]

But that’s exactly why they do it. Either way, I don’t want to post on this topic arguing all day… Cya.
